sentences.sContent: ...know that simplification ought to save money...
...we ought not to stop practicing what we've learned...
...we really ought to have a look at the schools; we want the children to have a good secondary education...
...one we ought to take steps to preserve as we would a historic building or a significant work of art...
...we ought to send him to a school with good vocational training—carpentry...
...The dry statistics ought to inform the ongoing deficit debate...
...Do you choose one because it’s what the public wants to know about or because it’s what you feel the public ought to know about...
...we also ought to ask some broader question about assimilation...
I realize I ought to have told you about it.
sentences.sCn: 我意识到我本该告诉你这件事的。

trans.tranOther: You use ought to have with a past participle to indicate that although it was best or correct for someone to do something in the past, they did not actually do it.
